html: The Hebrew superlative “most holy” or “thrice holy” (qados, qados, qados) reflects the highest of Isaiah’s spiritual levels—Jehovah’s. Emulating Jehovah are those in Isaiah’s seraph and son/servant categories, who are also called “holy” (qados) (Isaiah 13:3; 52:10). The seraphs’ anthem—“The consummation of all the earth is his glory!” (melo’ kol-ha’ares kebodo )—identifies the purpose of the earth’s creation as Jehovah’s “glory.” In other words, Jehovah is glorified by bringing the earth to its “consummation,” its purpose being fulfilled when it begets “holy ones” like him (Isaiah 4:3; 62:12).
